column4: it has pushed some programs out to swap to make room for file system cache.  In other words it sees that there are files that you are accessing more frequently than the programs, so it puts some programs into swap and keeps the files in memory instead to speed things up
the boot time is getting slower?
yes, also.
that is not normal.  Have you installed extra services since the initial install?

oh yeah. for example, i was playing around with sendmail. i got the sendmail package, then got rid of it again, yet every time i boot the graphical boot progress bar stops for a second, goes into text mode (showing whats going on right now), says that the mail transfer agent (MTA) is starting up. this takes like an extra 15+ seconds.
it still trying to start sendmail after the removal.  Odd. Let's make sure it's completely gone: dpkg -l | grep mail
does it show anything when you run that in a terminal?
oh yes
like 20 lines
do they all start with "ii" or do some say "rc" ?
some have rc
mostly ii though
does sendmail show as "ii"?
i got sendmail-base -bin and -cf, all are ii
sudo aptitude purge them to completely uninstall them
it said nothing got uninstalled
sudo aptitude purge  sendmail-base sendmail-bin sendmail-cf said nothing removed?
ok now theyre gone
but the system is still kinda running slow. what else could i do?
ok, so that might help speed boot time, but that won't make the netbook that much faster overall.
yeah exactly
sash_: also, the battery life is significantly slower than the promised 9.5h. even without bluetooth, wifi, cpu underclocked, low brightness no sound i never even get 6h
I don't have a netbook, so I can't say for sure what to do there...
